page.title: 01APPLETON ROEBUCK & DISTRICT
page.content: { Location:}Selby District,North Yorks about 9 km SSW of York;rural & resi- dential;flat,first class agricultural land,small pockets of woodland,most houses located in villages 1000+ years old;{Appleton Roebuck}largest,{Bolton {Percy}is half as big, but historically more important having the mediaeval Parish church and Gatehouse;Appleton became more important recently,has some buildings dating from the 17th C.but most are Victorian or Modern; much recent housing but population is only slightly larger than 1885;some service industries & farming;most people work outwith the area;few local {amenities},sport and entertainment are limited,2 churches,1 chapel,2 Primary schools,3 pubs,2 shop/post-offices, {York}is the central place for goods, services and employment;quiet,pleasant middle-class communities.
